body_html:
I replied to your post on the forums, feel free to reply to my comments there or here.

As an addenum, I tried running the following:

x = torch.zeros(3500000000//4)
torch.save(x, "tmp.txt")

and it runs in around 2 seconds for me (I am on an ssd, though).
body_text:
I replied to your post on the forums, feel free to reply to my comments there or here.
As an addenum, I tried running the following:
x = torch.zeros(3500000000//4)
torch.save(x, "tmp.txt")

and it runs in around 2 seconds for me (I am on an ssd, though).
body:
I replied to your post on the [forums](https://discuss.pytorch.org/t/using-torch-save-to-save-big-file-is-very-slow/10749/2), feel free to reply to my comments there or here. 

As an addenum, I tried running the following:
```
x = torch.zeros(3500000000//4)
torch.save(x, "tmp.txt")
```
and it runs in around 2 seconds for me (I am on an ssd, though).
